Class Slider

  • java.lang.Object
    • Slider

  • public class Slider
extends java.lang.Object
    This is object used as a starting point for our projectiles in the game. This object slides back and forth on an x axis just below the dunk tanks.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) boolean moving
      Represents the moving status for this object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Slider(java.lang.String fileName, int xPosition, int yPosition, int panelWidth) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws the slider on the screen
      Direction getDirection()
      Represents the direction in which the slider is moving.
      int getHeight()
      Gets the height of the image representing this slider
      int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the image representing this slider
      int getxPosition()
      Gets current x position of this slider; used for starting position of projectile
      int getyPosition()
      Gets current y position of this slider; used for starting position of projectile
      boolean isMoving()
      Used to determine if this slider is moving.
      void move(int distance)
      Move this slider either left or right based on the current direction and distance to the end of the game panel.
      void setDirection(Direction direction)
      Sets the moving direction of the slider.
      void startMovement()
      Used to start this slider by setting the moving variable to true.
      void stopMovement()
      Used to stop this slider by setting the moving variable to false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • moving

        boolean moving
        Represents the moving status for this object. It is set to true if this slider is moving, otherwise false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slider

        public Slider(java.lang.String fileName,
      int xPosition,
      int yPosition,
      int panelWidth)
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the image file that will be used to represent this slider.
        xPosition - Starting x position of this slider
        yPosition - Starting y position of this slider
        panelWidth - Width of the container to determine how far this slider will move in any direction.

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Used to determine if this slider is moving.
        Returns:
        True if this object is currently moving.

      • move

        public void move(int distance)
        Move this slider either left or right based on the current direction and distance to the end of the game panel.
        Parameters:
        distance - Integer used to decrement x position and determine whether to move right or not.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Direction direction)
        Sets the moving direction of the slider.
        Parameters:
        direction - Represents the direction in which the slider is moving

        Used to start this slider by setting the moving variable to true.

      • stopMovement

        Used to stop this slider by setting the moving variable to false.
